title: Peruvian Greek yogurt (0%) traybake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the air fryer to 180°C.
Toss aubergine and asparagus with half the walnuts, salt, pepper and italian herbs; spread on a tray.
Season greek yogurt (0%) and place on the tray. Air-fry for 37 min, turning once.
Cook the couscous according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Couscous or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Pork tenderloin Thai green curry paste bowl
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook pork tenderloin 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry courgette and peppers with thai green curry paste 10 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Pork for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Sourdough bread or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

Cook paneer 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry cherry tomatoes and courgette with thai green curry paste 8 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the whole-wheat pasta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Whole-wheat pasta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Tofu (firm) and Green beans Airfry
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the air fryer to 180°C.
Toss green beans and onion with half the ghee, salt, pepper and ras el hanout; spread on a tray.
Season tofu (firm) and place on the tray. Air-fry for 26 min, turning once.
Cook the jasmine rice according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Jasmine rice or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Israeli Greek yogurt (0%) traybake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 180°C.
Toss spinach and broccoli with half the tahini, salt, pepper and thai green curry paste; spread on a tray.
Season greek yogurt (0%) and place on the tray. Roast for 36 min, turning once.
Cook the polenta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Polenta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: French Paneer with Sweet potato & Broccoli
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat grill to high.
Heat peanut butter in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook paneer 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry broccoli and courgette with smoked paprika + cumin 12 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook sweet potato until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Sweet potato or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Aubergine & Cabbage Baby potatoes with Turkey breast
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat butter in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook turkey breast 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry aubergine and cabbage with thai green curry paste 9 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook baby potatoes until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Turkey for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Baby potatoes or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Italian Lentils with Baby potatoes & Garlic
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 180°C.
Toss garlic and aubergine with half the peanut butter, salt, pepper and lemon & herb; spread on a tray.
Season lentils and place on the tray. Roast for 26 min, turning once.
Cook baby potatoes until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Baby potatoes or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.
